parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> Arma 3
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.34
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Ropes and Sling Loading

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Creates a PhysX rope with given params. For <tt>Take on Helicopters</tt> syntax see [[ropeCreate_TKOH]].<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> FROM object has to be [[ropeCreate/transport | transport]] vehicle, alive with [[enableRopeAttach | rope attachment]] enabled, TO object has to be an entity, alive with [[enableRopeAttach | rope attachment]] enabled.<br><br>
<tt>ropeEndType</tt> is defined in config under <tt>"CfgNonAIVehicles" >> "RopeEnd"</tt>. Currently this is a hook that will be created on the end of the rope, and <tt>ropeEndDownVector</tt> is its orientation, [0,0,-1] for example. The <tt>"RopeEnd"</tt> is only shown when the rope is created object to object, it doesn't show on the open ended rope for some reason. There is currently no <tt>"RopeStart"</tt></value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[ropeCreate]] [fromObject, fromPoint, toObject, toPoint, length, ropeStart, ropeEnd]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>[fromObject, fromPoint, toObject, toPoint, length, ropeStart, ropeEnd]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> fromObject: [[Object]] - [[ropeCreate/transport | transport]] where the rope originates and which fly behavior will be affected
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> fromPoint: [[String]] or [[Array]] - position for the rope start, either a memory point [[String]] or relative offset [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> toObject: [[Object]] - entity which is automatically [[ropeAttachTo | attached to]] the end of the rope
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> toPoint: [[String]] or [[Array]] - position for the rope end, either a memory point [[String]] or relative offset [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p6</name>=<value> length (Optional): [[Number]] - rope length in meters. Default: -1
</value></part><part><name>p7</name>=<value> ropeStart (Optional): [[Array]] - array in format [ropeStartType, ropeStartDownVector] where:
* ropeStartType: [[String]] - type of the rope start (see description). Default: ""
* ropeStartDownVector: [[String]] or [[Array]], either a memory point [[String]] or relative vector [[Array]]. If [[String]] is given, then <tt>ropeStartDownVector</tt> is calculated from <tt>fromPoint</tt> towards <tt>ropeStartDownVector</tt> memory point. Default: [0,0,-1]
</value></part><part><name>p8</name>=<value> ropeEnd (Optional): [[Array]] - array in format [ropeEndType, ropeEndDownVector] where:
* ropeEndType: [[String]] - type of the rope end (see description). Default: ""
* ropeEndDownVector: [[String]] or [[Array]], either a memory point [[String]] or relative vector [[Array]]. If [[String]] is given, then <tt>ropeEndDownVector</tt> is calculated from <tt>toPoint</tt> towards <tt>ropeEndDownVector</tt> memory point. Default: [0,0,-1]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]] - created rope or [[objNull]] on failure
</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[ropeCreate]] [fromObject, fromPoint, length, ropeStart, ropeEnd]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> [fromObject, fromPoint, length, ropeStart, ropeEnd]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> fromObject: [[Object]] - [[ropeCreate/transport | transport]] where the rope originates and which fly behavior will be affected
</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> fromPoint: [[String]] or [[Array]] - position for the rope start, either a memory point [[String]] or relative offset [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> length: [[Number]] - rope length in meters
</value></part><part><name>p25</name>=<value> ropeStart (Optional): [[Array]] - array in format [ropeStartType, ropeStartDownVector] where:
* ropeStartType: [[String]] - type of the rope start (see description). Default: ""
* ropeStartDownVector: [[String]] or [[Array]], either a memory point [[String]] or relative vector [[Array]]. If [[String]] is given, then <tt>ropeStartDownVector</tt> is calculated from <tt>fromPoint</tt> towards <tt>ropeStartDownVector</tt> memory point. Default: [0,0,-1]
</value></part><part><name>p26</name>=<value> ropeEnd (Optional): [[Array]] - array in format [ropeEndType, ropeEndDownVector] where:
* ropeEndType: [[String]] - type of the rope end (see description). Default: ""
* ropeEndDownVector: [[Array]] - relative vector. Default: [0,0,-1]

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value>  [[Object]] - created rope or [[objNull]] on failure

</value></part><part><name>x1 </name>=<value> <code>myRope = [[ropeCreate]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[vehicle]] [[player]], "slingload0", myCargo, [0, 0, 0], 10];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2 </name>=<value> <code>myRope = [[ropeCreate]] [veh1, [0,0,-2], veh2, [0,0,0], 10];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x3 </name>=<value> Free end rope (Alt Syntax): <code>myRope = [[ropeCreate]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[vehicle]] [[player]], [0,0,0], 10];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x4 </name>=<value> A rope with a hook on the end: <code>myRope = [[ropeCreate]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>heli, "slingload0", [[player]], [0,0,2], 20, [], ["RopeEnd", [0,0,-1]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[ropeDestroy]], [[ropeDetach]], [[ropes]], [[canSlingLoad]], [[enableRopeAttach]], [[getSlingLoad]], [[ropeAttachedObjects]], [[ropeAttachTo]], [[ropeLength]], [[ropeUnwound]], [[ropeAttachedTo]], [[ropeAttachEnabled]], [[ropeCut]], [[ropeEndPosition]], [[ropeUnwind]]
</value></part></template>

[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>


<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 8, 2014 - 14:57 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tajin|Tajin]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Doesn't work well for towing vehicles on the ground.<br>
Their wheels don't turn freely and have a LOT of friction. You'll most likely end up flipping the vehicle over if you try to tow it.<br>
<br>
Also note that ropes can be destroyed/cut by shooting at them.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 4, 2015 - 03:24 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Feint|Feint]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Pay special attention to what is your '''fromObject''' and what is your '''toObject''' as this will have an impact on the physics of the rope.<br>
<br>
''For example:'' If you want to tow an Assault CRRC from a heavier Speedboat Minigun, attach two boats together with a rope.  If you drive the Speedboat Minigun and set the CRRC as the fromObject, the rope will have almost no elasticity and the CRRC will yank around as you tow it.  However, if you set the CRRC as the toObject, the rope will have more elasticity and will be a little friendlier for the CRRC when you are towing it.
</dd>

<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
